summary: If your bank failed, what would happen to the money in your checking or savings account? The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation insures more than $7 trillion in deposits against bank failures—up to $250,000 per individual depositor. We audit the financial statements of FDIC's insurance funds each year and issue an opinion on them, as well as on the effectiveness of the agency's internal controls (e.g...
title: Financial Audit: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Funds' 2018 and 2017 Financial Statements
